text: It wasn't the season for it really, typically that would have happened half a year or so prior. It still didn't keep them from leaving a series of carbon prints on each other. Makes you wonder if it was by design since the only other set of them prints can be found in the mirror.

author: C Attrition
text:
That woodsy area today is now gone with little remnants. They bulldozed most and put up a new cul de sac development up & back there. I
Be interested to know the whereabouts of Mikey K... Is he around, well, stable?
Lifes a barrel of mystery that never empties out. Time'll tell!

author: C Attrition
text: distraught & a little panicked to notice it. Unfortunately she'd started having troubles in her life. Troubles she told the world of but fell on deaf ears. They'd still be friendly a bit but he felt extremely worried/helpless when in contact for the rest of her days as well.

author: C Attrition
text: He had a special internet friend that came & went from his since then. in his eyes she could have literally been the first Lady President of the US... he thought that highly of her in a short span of chatting. However she & only she noticed the mark out of all people & seemed

author: C Attrition
text:
not pondered believe in the slightest. And since the stories were flowing he'd throw in a story of Okinawa or the desert.
Well it's been 7 years now since big bro passed on in tragic fashion. So he told his spouse about he & big Bros day and she's lovely went along. She would.

author: C Attrition
text: his other friends. Once in a while would drop a line and reminsce but that would fizzle out. He & big bro would keep referencing this one day for decades to anyone they grew close to. His wife laughed it off in disbelief but every one else was at least entertained by the story if

author: C Attrition
text: wanting to sound nutty around the grown-ups. Brenda & Kevin would move down to Arkansas courtesy of their dad's job opportunity the same time the 80s wrapped up. He & Mikey would be friends & foes for til they hit freshman year where he'd move to Everett for the same reason as

author: C Attrition
text: He had a shared b-day party at Chuck E. Cheese a week later for him and baby bro. Of course the others showed plus a few more. But there was tension amongst them, and he was still grounded as of the day of the party & the group would exchange concerned stares at one another. Not

author: C Attrition
text: to his parents where this new tiny speck of a birthmark looking thing came from since last seeing him not long beforehand. They got nothing from both brother's about it. What could they say? They were still rattled plus who'd believe what had just took place without seeing it.

author: C Attrition
text: time it takes to crack an egg. No pain, distinctly. No pain just a very narrow yet aggressive pinch. Got him between his ear & temple, big bro on the shoulder which he later covered up with a tattoo of a bulldog, homage to his football team. But him... He had a hard time trying

author: C Attrition
text:
Kevin & Brenda from directly across the street were there that day too. 
His brother were closest to this figure oblivious before Mike would Hollar out "What is that thing! Jesus. Omg! Get away guys. Quick. Get away now!" He and his brother both got punctures to the flesh in the

author: C Attrition
text: The newest to the group Mikey K was closest in age to him & was the one to spot the figure up ahead about 100 yds from his back door yet fairly deep into the wooded area. Right beside that one tree that Kevin had fallen off clumsily a year before while trying to show off climbing

author: C Attrition
text: He was 6, big bro was 8 & the youngest hadn't even been around a whole year by that time. It was really the first time the 5 pals would decide to go into the untouched woods that ran deep and positioned crooked at a slight angle with the western side was highest from the ground.

author: C Attrition
text: He & his brother would gasp-laugh regularly over the years whenever someone would bring up any ghost sighting type stories as if to say 'hold my beer'... For old-time sake, what 5 little neighborhood friends caught a glimpse of on 10/18/88 is worthy a moment... https://t.co/PeKprt3iV2

author: C Attrition
text:
Here's a mind-blowing blast from the past recollection:
When he'd piss off the ex old-lady, instead yelling or mentioning the sofa she would just tell him "rub one out in my honor."
The bizarre part was that he was told the very same words from his ill-fading
Capo's death-bed.

author: C Attrition
text:
bodies on the job. The snowfall seemed sadistically laughable considering the particular day of 4/1/97.
Crazy to believe it's been a quarter century. Even foes could easily agree that time flies."

author: C Attrition
text: "Them boys never saw the one that hit in '78, it was just before their time... but one needed the ones help during that out-of-the-blue blizzard hit as the paper route was waiting for them but the papers hadn't got there yet. A route that usually took an hour turned into 2 with 2

author: C Attrition
text: "... Would rather just pick my spots than be forced to pick my battles... but what can you do sometimes, eh."

author: C Attrition
text:
"Listen now because I'm only gonna tell you this once... If you plate anything you had on & bring it out on to the floor, it better be something you'd serve yourself or loved ones, or I'd rather you not even bother... Capisce?"

Lui V

author: C Attrition
text:
Knocking down walls but replacing the sheets after insulating beyond the surface. 
A trade, method, art-form, philosophy, hobby, lifestyle, and pretty solid metaphor for life.

author: C Attrition
text:
There's no true duality without quality.
There's no true quality without duality.
